content.question: Based on the graph in Figure 2, identify the environmental conditions (flower density AND proportion of deep flowers) where a short-tongued bee has the greatest relative advantage over a long-tongued bee. Based on the graph in Figure 2, identify the range of proportion of deep flowers at which a long-tongued bee always has an advantage over a short-tongued bee.

frqParts.text: Based on the graph in Figure 2, identify the environmental conditions (flower density AND proportion of deep flowers) where a short-tongued bee has the greatest relative advantage over a long-tongued bee. Based on the graph in Figure 2, identify the range of proportion of deep flowers at which a long-tongued bee always has an advantage over a short-tongued bee.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
